page.title: 05SW BASINGSTOKE: EDUCATION 2
page.content: Most children on entering primary school at five years old have attended one of the several playschools held around the area. Each of the modern primary schools has approximately 350 pupils. At the age of 11 pupils transfer to the much larger Brighton Hill Comprehensive School where a wide range of subjects are taught to examination level, usually by specialist teachers.At the age of 16, they will have the opportunity to continue their studies at the Technical College or Sixth Form College in Basingstoke. Many of the facilities of Brighton Hill School are also used in the evenings by the Community Association, Sports organizations and the Institute of Adult Education.
